parts.part:
Which is the parent class:
Base Der Both none of the above

How many classes can inherit from the parent class
only one one or more we can't inherit from a parent class'

When running the first line in the main function, the item(s) printed on the console is/are :
Base Basei Der Base Der

When running the second line in the main function,the item(s) printed on the console is are :
Der Der2 Base2 Base2 Der2 Base Der2

After finishing the program programthe destructors will be called, the item(s) printed on the console is/are :
Destruct Base Destruct Der Destruct Base Destruct Base Destruct Base Destruct Der Destruct Der Destruct Base Destruct Base Destruct Base

When running the line 1, the output will be:
1 3 compilation error None of the above

When running the line 2 , the output will be:
1 2 4 5
When running the line 3 , the output will be: 3 7 5 4

When running the line 4 the output will be:
ERROR 1 3 5

When running the line 5 the output will be:
ERROR 5 4 2

questions.question:
What is meant by multiple inheritance?
Deriving a base class from derived class Deriving a derived class from base class Deriving a derived class from more than one base class None of the mentioned

To overload the += operator:
Only the = operator needs to be overloaded Both the + and = operators need to be overloaded The += operator need to be overloaded Only the + operator needs to be overloaded

Can we define constructors as virtual?
Yes, this can be done at any class Never Only in parent classes Only in child classes

We can call a class as abstract class when:
One or more functions are abstract All functions are abstract Only one function is abstract More than one function is abstract

Can we make an object of an abstract class?
Yes Never Only if the abstract class is a parent class Only if the abstract class is a child class

When making a function abstract we put:
=0 at the begining of function definition =0 at end of function definition !=0 at the begining of function definition !=0 at the begining of function definition

When making a member function const, we put:
const at the begining of function definition const at end of function definition const at the begining of function definition and declartion const at the end of function definition and declartion

.......class members can be called directly from outside the class
public Private Protected Inherited

.... members are accessible in the class that defines them and in classes that inherit from that class.
Public Private Protected None of the above

Ability of a type to take many forms is called .
Polymorphism Encapsulation Inheritance None of the above

Vectores are implemented using:
Linked list Stack Array Tree Hash table

Maps in STL library are implemented as:
Linked list Stack Array Tree Hash table

Unordered map in STL library are implemented as:
Linked list Stack Array Tree Hash table

Why to pass an object as a const?
To make sure nobody alters the members of that object To call the constructor directly of that passed object To make sure that this passed parameter of type object None of the above
